intro: Gynerium procerum, commonly known as the tall goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. Gynerium procerum thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important plant for pollinators and a valuable component of native plant ecosystems.
